cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 275 mi WSW of Acapulco, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW for a day, then turning NW to NNW and tracking parallel to the southwest Mexican coast toward the southern Baja California peninsula, eventually moving up the length of Baja and remaining offshore of Southern California.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Baja California peninsula (near Cabo San Lucas area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (interests in SW Mexico and Baja advised to monitor)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southwestern Mexico from Guerrero to Jalisco and the Baja California peninsula
weather_observation.first_hazard: Start of heavy surf / rip currents
weather_observation.wind: Only a 4% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (â‰¥34 kt) winds by day 5; breezy conditions possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor swell; no significant storm-surge inundation expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Little to no direct rainfall expected at San Diego from Kay.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and higher seas could affect small-craft operations and port approaches late in the week.
